alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 11:58AM PDT until September 12 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The far eastern foothills and adjacent high desert of the Antelope Valley in Los Angeles County. * WHEN...Until 200 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1155 AM PDT, radar indicated a nearly stationary thunderstorm producing heavy rainfall with rates up to around one inch per hour.Roadway flooding including Highway 138 is possible. This will also cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Highway 138 between Llano and the San Bernardino County line. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
